intro: Tephroseris pratensis, commonly known as the meadow tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. It features slender, upright stems with small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture.
